task_summary: The robot arm locates, grasps, and moves the teapot from its starting position, placing it securely onto the stove surface in a staged sequence ensuring stable grasp and precise alignment.

task_long_description.overview: This episode involves a robot arm using visual and motion primitives to pick up a teapot and move it onto a stove within a toy kitchen scene. The process includes object search, approach, stable grasp, lift, transfer, place down, and gripper release. Real-world constraints such as vision-based alignment, collision-avoidance, and controlled placement are managed via sub-steps. All actions occur in a compact workspace with high precision and visibility required to manipulate the teapot onto the stove area.
preconditions: Teapot is present and unobstructed on the counter.
Robot is powered and actuators are homed.
stepwise_plan: Visually confirm or reacquire the teapot.
Move to a pregrasp pose above the teapot; open gripper.
Compute and align for a top grasp.
Approach and lower until gentle contact; close gripper.
Move above stove in a safe transfer trajectory.
Place teapot onto stove surface; release gripper.
Retreat from the placement site, wait to ensure completion.
success_criteria: Teapot is fully released and supported on stove.
No collision or spill during pick-transfer-place.
failure_and_recovery: Failure to detect objects triggers scan or retry.
Contact failures abort before unintended push.
Placement misalignment triggers a retry or halt.
task_long_description.termination: Episode ends after teapot stably released on stove and arm has retreated.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

task_instruction: Place the teapot on the stove

node_specs.description: Checks if the teapot is detected in the camera view.
Performs a grid scan to search for the teapot.
Runs perception to localize the teapot.
Opens the gripper to prepare for grasp.
Moves the end-effector above the teapot for grasp.
Computes top-down grasp pose for the teapot.
Approaches and precisely aligns with the teapot.
Lowers gripper until contact with teapot detected.
Closes gripper with moderate force to secure grasp.
Checks for stable grasp before lifting.
Checks if stove is visible in camera.
Places teapot on stove with slight downward force.
Opens gripper to release teapot on stove.

failure_modes: Teapot not found during initial perception
Failed grasp or unstable teapot in gripper
Placement attempts result in off-stove or collision
recovery_strategy: Scan then retry if object not visible
Redo grasp sequence if instability detected
Abort if critical collision detected during motion
Retry or halt upon unsafe placement
assumptions: Instruction and visual evidence are coherent: teapot is handled and placed on stove in frames 0–8.
Target object identities ('teapot','stove') inferred with confidence from visual features—no ambiguity.
No non-obvious constraints or objects interfere with execution.

expected_success_criteria: Teapot is stably resting on stove at episode end; not in the gripper
Arm does not collide with kitchen environment or objects
All BT nodes complete without error
